fields.summary: Configurable display of full name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32169].
  {panel}

It would be nice having meaning ful urls for fix versions. Right now the links looks like 
http://mybuildingorg.jira.com/browse/MB/fixforversion/10201 

That number doesn't say alot when we emailed it.

If it could be http://mybuildingorg.jira.com/browse/MB/version/1.1.17 instead, it would be great.
fields.summary: meaningful URLs for versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32168].
  {panel}

It would be beneficial so we can manage the volume of emails from JIRA if there were email headers set which indicates what properties in the issue have changed.  Sometimes other parts of the issue like the Description, etc. are included even when they haven't changed.

Ideally it would be helpful to be able to filter when the change notification is because either a comment, the description or the assignee has changed.

Also, it would be helpful to detect whether the version that an issue has been moved to matches a particular condition (i.e. an issue has been moved into an iteration).

This probably isn't a Studio enhancement (or maybe it is), but may actually be a JIRA enhancement.  But it would really help us better manage the email volume.

Thanks!
fields.summary: When an email is sent after an issue has been updated, the email has a header indicating what values have changed
When releasing project and rolling open issues to next release, give option to turn off emails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32166].
  {panel}

It appears that rss feeds based on saved filters with 'fixVersion IS NULL' behave different than ones with 'fixVersion = 1234'.
I am trying to create some rss feeds to get notified when my boss moves issues in an out of fixVersions in hopes that I won't miss anything.  It has happened where something gets moved last minute without my knowledge we end up releasing the incorrect code.
I have asked my boss to inform me when this happens, but he continues to do this anyway.  My goal is to detect when he moves tickets in or out of the current fixVersion, so all the proper docs and commits can be updated appropriately.  

To that end, here is what I've attempted:
I have created 3 saved filters all based on fixVersions.
Here are the queries for the filters:
fixVersion=10236 AND status=Open
fixVersion IS NULL AND status=Open
fixVersion=10237 AND status=Open

Those filters are saved as requestIds 10228, 10229, and 10230 respectively.

From these, I have created the following rss feeds:
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10228/SearchRequest-10228.xml?os_authType=basic
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10229/SearchRequest-10229.xml?os_authType=basic
https://myCompany.jira.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/10230/SearchRequest-10230.xml?os_authType=basic

I've imported these feeds into Thunderbird 2 and 3, and see all the issues currently in each fixVersion.

To test the feeds, I edit an issue with fixVersion 10236 so that it's fixVersion is now 'Unknown'.  The feed based on filter 10229 updates with a new item, as expected. Next I test the opposite case, where an item currently has fixVersion NULL and edit it to be 10236; the feed for filter 10228 is not updated with the new issue.

I also tested changing the fixVersion from 10236 to 10237 and again there was no notification. 

I only received notifications when issues were moved into fixVersion NULL.

My company is using Jira Studio 2.3
fields.summary: RSS feeds from saved filters not consistently returning results to rss readers

fields.summary: Profiling upon JIRA startup is not allowing user creation
Ability to sort Versions on JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior
When processing an e-mail, look up the corresponding user by e-mail prioritizing the directory according to the configured order.

h3. Actual Behavior
JIRA may search for the user in another directory and fail to process the e-mail if that user is inactive or doesn't have enough permissions. Also, it may set the wrong issue reporter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two users with the same e-mail address, one in JIRA's internal directory and another in an external directory;
# Regardless of the order of directories, JIRA will get the user from the internal directory;

h3. Workaround
Delete the user that should not be used, or change/remove the e-mail address.
fields.summary: Mail handler doesn't respect the order of User Directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32154].
  {panel}

Currently the "Ability to view or edit an issue's due date" are bundled in 1 permission: Schedule Issues.
There can be a situation where a user-groups/project roles should be allowed to see the due date but not to edit it.
i.e.: our support wants to be able to tell our customers when a feature/a fix will be ready.
But they are not allowed to change the schedule.


We need to split the permission into two parts : 
# View, and
# Edit
fields.summary: Permission "Schedule Issues": View but not edit

fields.description: Within the last few days, I applied for an Atlassian On-demand account and it was created using what I'm assuming is the latest build of JIRA,6.0-OD-07.2, (this was not an option to select in the "Versions Affected" for this issue) build 6031.  As a side note, I migrated my data from 5.1.7, build 786.  I no longer have the capability to search for issues using the basic search, because the pop-up to refine search criteria when clicking "Project", "Issue Type", etc, is not displayed.  This does not appear to be a browser-specific issue, though I am using Google Chrome 25.0.1364.172 m.  The javascript console provides the information that you can see in the attachment to this issue when any of the fields that I'm trying to refine are clicked.  The advanced search criteria works as expected.
fields.summary: Basic Search does not provide pop-up for criteria selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32146].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Bullet lists for nested items display incorrectly, with white space appearing. Additionally, preview displays the white space below where as the actual comment displays it above.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the following to a comment:
{noformat}
* This is OK
* As is this (~[mention])
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!
{noformat}
# Preview it and watch for the white space.
# Save it and watch the white space 

For example:

* This is OK
* As is this ([~dcurrie@atlassian.com])
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!

h3. Expected Results

There is no white space in either preview or the saved comment where the arrow is pointed in the example screenie.

h3. Actual Results

There is white space, below and above the bullet.

h3. Notes

Without the mention the comment renders without error but the preview still renders incorrectly:

* This is OK
* As is this
** And this one
* But it gets bad here!
fields.summary: Bullet List displays too much white space and renders incorrectly

fields.description:
In the class com.atlassian.jira.dashboard.JiraWhitelist, the request URL is compared, lowercased, to the base URL defined in the General Configuration page, *not* lowercased.

For URL like ours (http://hostname/DirectorateGeneral/jira) the first test 

{code}
uriString.startsWith(canonicalBaseUrl)
{code}

will always fail.

Also, the request URL is converted to ASCII and the base url is not. This might lead to problems as well in certain case.

A bit of logging can be useful as well in setup with reverse proxy. Sometimes, we cannot see what is being compared with what (especially when in need to debug a gadget)


Thx

{noformat}
Can't display issues
Either you don't have access to view them or they don't exist. Please contact your system administrator if you believe this is incorrect.
instead of the integration I was hoping for.
{noformat}

* Set a destination step for the affected transition.
* Do not set global transition as it only affects global transition.

fields.description:
Hello, 

While looking at JIRA's Project Importer Tool we found that a number of custom field types did not get their value carried over. 

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a project that has screens that contain fields all of the following field types
* Select List
* Cascading Select List
* Multi Select Lists
* Multi Checkbox field
* Radio Button
# Create an issue and fill the above mentioned fields with values
# Create a backup of the system
# Delete the project
# Use JIRA's Project Importer to import the project back into the JIRA Instance

*Expected Results:*
All the values you filled in before the backup should be in the fields.

*Actual Results:*
All fields are blank.


There might be other fields that are affected but so far I have tried with the above mentioned field types as well as the following who worked:
* Text Field
* Free Text Fields
* Numeric Fields


Best Regards,
Rickard Johansson
Tieto

# Shutdown JIRA;
# Remove the {{stp-3.0.25.jar}} from the [{{$JIRA_HOME}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/JIRA+Home+Directory]{{/plugins/installed-plugins}}
# Restart JIRA.

Often when on support we have customers uploading screenshots and attachments as well as other supporters.  I would love a fast way to differentiate these.   

Whether they are sorted, grouped, labelled I don't mind.

Thanks,
Brydie

fields.description:
When viewing issue navigator, the Created, Updated, and Resolved is referring to the date format in Look and Feel. But when exporting to an Excel document, it uses date time format instead.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Look and Feel > Change the date format to dd.MM.yyyy
# View issues in issue navigator show the format set according to dd.MM.yyyy set
# Export the issue and you will notice that the format exported is referring to dd/MMM/yyyy hh:mm a (date time format default) instead of dd.MM.yyyy.

*Workaround*
Set similar format for date time format and date format in Look and Feel.
fields.summary: Mismatch Between Issue Navigator and Excel Export on Date Format

fields.description:
Create, Last Viewed, Updated and Resolved Fields display inconsistency over the months March, May, October and December when the date format is set to Germany, other months are shown correctly. 

Refer below for the screenshot:
!dateformat.PNG!

*Steps to replicate:*
# Change system date time setting to Germany (Germany)
# Remain Jira on English default language
# Create an issue on the affected month
# Search issue on issue navigator
# Export to excel

I believe that this is due to the first 3 characters on the affected months by referring to the chart below:

||English||German||
|March|Mrz|
|May|Mai|
|October|Oktober|
|December|Dezember|

*Workaround*
Change the look and feel for date format and date time format to dd.MM.yyyy instead of dd.MMM.yyyy and the excel export should be showing correct formatting.

*Additional Note*
When setting Jira default language to Germany, only the month March is affected by this behaviour. Refer screenshot below:
!GermanyDate.PNG!
fields.summary: Create, Last Viewed, Updated and Resolved Fields Does Not Respect German System Time Format During Excel Export

fields.description:
When the Mail Handler picks up an email with .txt attachments, it takes the contents of those .txt files (all of it) and concatenates it with the original email body and uses it as the issue description when the issue is created. 
This also happens when creating comments from email.

Tested on JIRA version 5.2.5. Also tested with various .txt attachment combinations, even if you have a 4000-line .txt file, JIRA takes all of it and uses it as the Issue Description/Comment. It also concatenates multiple .txt attachments together.

=============Tests done=================
Sending client: Yahoo Email (Not Plus)
Mail Handler client: Gmail IMAP
Results: Bug occurs

Sending client: Gmail
Mail Handler client: Gmail IMAP
Results: Bug occurs
fields.summary: Mail Handler takes content of .txt attachments and concatenates it with the email body as Issue Description or Comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32076].
  {panel}

My company's security team ran a vulnerability scan against our JIRA and found this issue.  They advised me to bring it to your attention as an opportunity to improve security.

Summary:
{quote}
Some web frameworks collapse the POST and GET parameters into a single collection. This is a flawed design pattern from a security standpoint. If a page accepts POST parameters as GET parameters an attacker would be able to effect change on websites through Cross-Site Request Forgery or leverage this design flaw with other vulnerabilities to attack the system hosting the web application. POST variables and GET variables should be distinct and no attempt to collapse to two collections should occur.
{quote}

An example showing how to demonstrate the issue:
Input: {quote}
GET /login.jsp?atl_token&os_username=12345&os_password=foo&os_cookie=true&os_destination=%2fsecure%2fDashboard.jspa&login=Log%20In HTTP/1.1
Referer: https://ourJira.local:443/login.jsp
Accept: */*
Pragma: no-cache
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; .NET CLR 1.1.4322)
Host: ft-jira.mattersight.net
X-Scan-Memo: Category="Audit"; Function="createStateRequestFromAttackDefinition"; SID="FBF9E4FEE5C7BA725AF21068F08BDAF6"; PSID="280981CE8E66BF997A623A77CC318FFD"; SessionType="AuditAttack"; CrawlType="None"; AttackType="Other"; OriginatingEngineID="8ca14a29-1566-423d-b9f8-f46aa279ec29"; AttackSequence="0"; AttackParamDesc=""; AttackParamIndex="0"; AttackParamSubIndex="0"; CheckId="10655"; Engine="Form+Accepts+GET+Variables"; Retry="False"; SmartMode="NonServerSpecificOnly"; ThreadId="55"; ThreadType="AuditDBReaderSessionDrivenAudit"; 
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: CustomCookie=WebInspect78498ZX4A2C8EB0ABD54C51AC87E7A4AB6BBC75Y3A46;atlassian.xsrf.token=BOKD-JKJB-95MZ-P5IW|b6c98b43b2686e19d437215c8d0bdc6d5054a134|lout;JSESSIONID=072444395FA06364137381BBBF290A43
{quote}

Response:
{quote}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 1310x84951x8
X-ASESSIONID: 13aee16
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
X-Seraph-LoginReason: AUTHENTICATED_FAILED
X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8

Content-Length: 7751

<!DOCTYPE html>
...
{quote}

fields.description:
This was tested on JIRA v6.0-m08 with the default JIRA workflow.

h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Create a user with username 'test'
2. Make sure the user 'test' has the project permission _Assignable User_
3. Create a new issue ABC-123
4. Assign ABC-123 to 'test' user
5. Rename 'test' user to something else, eg. 'testtest'
6. Transition ABC-123 to 'In Progress' step (_Start Progress_ transition)

(!) Same results if the issue is already in the 'In Progress' status, and attempting to transition issue back to 'Open' step (_Stop Progess_ transition)

It appears to be related to the Workflow condition "Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition". If that condition is removed from either transition, it will work as expected.

h3. Expected Results
- Issue transitions to _In Progress_

h3. Actual Results
- Error: "Action 4 is invalid"

Stack trace in the logs:
{code}
2013-03-12 15:03:19,643 http-bio-8080-exec-25 ERROR testtest 903x761x1 1l7onax 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager] Caught exception while attempting to perform action 4 from workflow 10006 on issue 'DEMO-7'
com.opensymphony.workflow.InvalidActionException: Action 4 is invalid
	at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.doAction(AbstractWorkflow.java:559)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowActionInsideTxn(OSWorkflowManager.java:952)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowAction(OSWorkflowManager.java:907)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.transition(DefaultIssueService.java:451)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.workflow.SimpleWorkflowAction.doExecute(SimpleWorkflowAction.java:30)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:85)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:221)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:185)
{code}

h3. Workaround
- Remove condition "Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition." from both _Start Progress_ and _Stop Progress_ transitions.

|!View-Workflow.png!|
\\
\\
*Upon editing the workflow using the Workflow Designer:*
|!Edit Workflow.png!|

For JIRA versions lower than 6.0.x, please see our [Exceptions using Workflow Designer / View Workflow using Java 1.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=329978064] KB for further information on applying a workaround.

A few teams have projects that contain 50-100 versions associated with.

The problem is that the "Version Picker" combo boxes, only show a certain number of matches, and then max out and don't display the rest.

If you have 25 versions that being with 1. and you type in 1. into the Fix Versions picker, you see some but not all of the auto-completed matches.

A few teams have projects that contain 50-100 versions associated with it.
The problems happens when you have many that begin with 1 for example. And if you type 1 into the Fix Version field. You see some but not all of the auto-completed matches. Even if you try to refine, you need to be able to see more of them. This implies that you remember exactly what all the versions are, but the whole point of auto-match is to help you remember.

*Summary of The Request*

JIRA [nested group option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups] currently does not respect deactivated directory. When a directory is disabled, this option is still available even thought the other directory does not have "Nested Group" option enabled.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32044].
  {panel}

Provide the ability to utilize conditions on the initial Create step so that you can have post functions based on those conditions. 

Use Case: 
If an issue is associated with a client that is not live, I want to route the issue to our implementation organization. If an issue is associated with a client that is live, I want to route the issue to our support organization. 

The only way I can accomplish this is to either have two issue types: one for pre-live and one for post live. However, this seems overkill as it then requires additional maintenance and avoid having to move issues between issue types if the user initially chooses the wrong one. 
The other is require that they save and then submit because on submit I can create two transitions: one that is valid for each option of the issue field: Is Client Live? If yes, the assignment is A; if no, the assignment is B.  However, we have done this in a couple of work flows and find out that people forget to click submit because they complete all of the information on create and don't realize it is a two-step process. 

On create, since I can only route to one step, I need the condition option to evaluate the assignee.
fields.summary: Ability to have conditions on Create
Not possible to make required fields on an Issue Collector form

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32042].
  {panel}

Steps
* Clone an issue
* view the Linkes issues in both the original and cloned issue

Original issue *clones* New issue
New issue *is cloned by* original issue


Shouldn't this be the other way around?
fields.summary: Link relationship shows "original issue" clones "new issue" when cloning an issue
